required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tau Screening Study in Subjects With Early Symptomatic AD
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Screening Study With Flortaucipir F 18 in Patients With Early Symptomatic AD; #2

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is designed to serve as a pre-screening study for subjects who are potentially eligible for Alzheimer's Disease (AD) therapeutic trials that require tau imaging for inclusion by means of a flortaucipir F18 Positron Emission Tomography (PET) scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Completion of a flortaucipir F18 PET scan
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dose administration within 30 days of screening assessment
primary_outcome.description: There is no formal hypothesis to test in this screening study. The study will pre-screen patients via a flortaucipir F18 scan who have cognitive impairment and etiology diagnosed or suspected to be AD, and have interest in participating in trials that require tau imaging for inclusion. The outcome measure will report the number of subjects pre-screened.

arm_group.description: Patients who receive 18F-AV-1451 dose after being successfully screened and are interested in participating in AD therapeutic clinical trials (and are not known to meet any exclusion criteria for those AD therapeutic clinical trials).

intervention.description: Subjects will receive single IV administration of 370 megabecquerel (MBq)(10 millicurie [mCi]) of 18F-AV-1451

facility.name: Neuropsychiatric Research Center of Southwest Florida
